title: Physics-Based Problem-Solving Project Utilizing Engineering Design Process

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate understanding of fundamental physics concepts and awareness of basic engineering design processes
context.additional_context: Focuses on solving real-world workplace problems using physics principles for technical personnel in corporate settings. Conducts pre-learning via flipped classroom methods, followed by team-based projects, utilizing collaboration tools based on individual BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) environments.

learning_goals: Learners can solve physics-based problems by applying the five-stage engineering design process (Define-Research-Plan-Create-Evaluate)
Learners develop the ability to integrate physics theories into practical engineering design problems based on flipped learning materials
Learners can produce prototype fabrication and verification reports considering physical constraints through team projects
Project-based assessment allows learners to demonstrate their ability to apply physics principles in problem-solving processes.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
